creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Pair of Tien Huang Stone Seals, carved in high relief at the top with Dogs of Foo. Four Characters on each seal. The four characters on one seal read'Official Seal of Po-Hsi'(Seal of Chang Po-Hsi, a well known scholar and Minister of Education who lived 1847-1907.) On Second seal 'Han Lin Ping Chen'(Han Ling a member of the Imperial Academy of Literature; Ping Cheng the cyclical year 1856 whin he entered the Academy. Note Tien Huang, produced in Shou Shan in Foo-Kien is a rare stone for making seals in China. Examples of this size extremely rare. The late dates of the characters on these 18th century seals are derived from the fact that scholars collected old seals and put their names on them after grinding off name of previous owner.
title: Pair of Seals
